actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow employees a deduction for savings contributions to employer retirement plans or to individual retirement plans.

summary.text: Employee Retirement Savings Act of 1981 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow employees who are participants in tax-qualified employer retirement plans an income tax deduction for contributions to such plans or to individual retirement plans. Limits the amount of such deduction to the amount by which the employee's compensation for the taxable year or $2,000, whichever is less, exceeds the sum of amounts contributed by the employer for an annuity contract and any amount of employment tax which would be paid if the employee were subject to the employment tax.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow employees a deduction for savings contributions to employer retirement plans or to individual retirement plans.
